channel.title: [317 Delta] add spellbook options
channel.description: how do yo add spellbook options and make them teleport you places??

item.title: [317 Delta] add spellbook options
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

Of course it matters what case it’s in. The case is pretty much the id of the button you are clicking. To find out the case, just click on a button and it will appear in your cmd

Read full topic

@zzjimmy wrote:

Those are my teleports. You would have to add your own coordinates.

Put it under any break statement.

item.title: [317 Delta] add spellbook options
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
@supermimez wrote:

Code: [Select]

case 9178://kbd
c.triggerTele2(3051, 9545, 0);
break;
case 9179://kq
c.triggerTele2(2855, 3792, 0);
break;
case 9180://giant mole
c.triggerTele2(2579, 3908, 0);
break;
case 9181://tormented
c.triggerTele2(2842, 9560, 0);
break;


where do i put these?

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] add spellbook options
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

Go to clickingmost.java
Find the case of the button that you want to click for the frame to pop up. Then you have to find the id of the frame that you want to pop up when you click the button. After you do that, you will have to get the cases the frame options cases. Then use those cases to create the locations that you want to get teleported to. Here’s an example of one of my teleports:

case 6004: c.teleEffect = 1; c.sendQuest("Which Boss?", 2481); c.sendQuest("King Black Dragon", 2482); c.sendQuest("Kalphite Queen", 2483); c.sendQuest("Giant Mole", 2484); c.sendQuest("Tormented Demons", 2485); c.sendFrame164(2480); break;

case 6004:
this is the Id of the button

c.sendFrame164(2480);
this is the Id of the frame and the things above it are the options.

now here are the actual teles:


case 9178://kbd
c.triggerTele2(3051, 9545, 0);
break;
case 9179://kq
c.triggerTele2(2855, 3792, 0);
break;
case 9180://giant mole
c.triggerTele2(2579, 3908, 0);
break;
case 9181://tormented
c.triggerTele2(2842, 9560, 0);
break;

the cases are the Id’s of the options in the frame and this allows allows you to teleport to the area of your choosing when you click each individual option

Read full topic
